FuncDef:
The negotiation auto command enables auto-negotiation on an optical Ethernet interface.
The negotiation default command restores the default configuration.
The undo negotiation auto command disables auto-negotiation on an optical Ethernet interface.
By default, Auto-negotiation is enabled on electrical Ethernet interfaces.Auto-negotiation is disabled on optical Ethernet interfaces.
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
On a large-scale Ethernet network, manually setting the interface rate and duplex mode, verifying the configurations of devices, and checking statistics about Ethernet interfaces require a great deal of time and human input. Therefore, it is recommended that manually setting the interface rate and duplex mode be adopted only when auto-negotiation of an Ethernet link fails or a problem occurs with auto-negotiation.
Configuration Impact
If both ends support auto-negotiation, the duplex mode with a weaker capability is adopted. Interconnected devices working in auto-negotiation mode is the prerequisite to the auto-negotiation mechanism. If one end works in auto-negotiation mode while the other end works in fixed mode, the auto-negotiation mechanism does not take effect.
Precautions
When the undo negotiation auto command is run to cancel the autonegotiation configurations, a message is added to prompt users to ensure consistent configuration on the two ends. If a GE electrical interface works at 1000 Mbit/s, it can work only in full-duplex mode.
